I believe the "state token" should relate to the state of the resource, and therefore be reproducible in the case that the state of the resource does not change.
The idea is that the state token can be subsequently used by a client when requesting to make a change to a resource. If the state token can not be reproduced on the server-side when determining whether the client-provided state token represents the current state or not... then the utility of the token is lost.
I think this should be addressed in a separate JIRA: https://jira.lyrasis.org/browse/FCREPO-3169

I just double-checked to make sure...
As far as I can tell, this change removes LinkHeaderProvider from any execution flow.
The previous logic was that ContentExposingResource would invoke the HttpHeaderInjector:
https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/blob/master/fcrepo-http-api/src/main/java/org/fcrepo/http/api/ContentExposingResource.java#L691
..which looks for Spring-managed classes that implement UriAwareHttpHeaderFactory:
https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/blob/master/fcrepo-http-commons/src/main/java/org/fcrepo/http/commons/api/HttpHeaderInjector.java#L81
By changing LinkHeaderProviders annotation from @Component (Spring) to @Provider (jax-rs), the class is no longer found by HttpHeaderInjector... and therefore never invoked.

nodes.bodyText:
There is a more fundamental issue, which may have been the reason for your introduction of this change, which is how the TransactionProvider is now trying to be used. It is trying to be managed by both jax-rs (@Provider) and Spring (@Component):
https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/blob/master/fcrepo-http-commons/src/main/java/org/fcrepo/http/commons/session/TransactionProvider.java#L38-L40
..which I do not think is possible.
Additionally, the TransactionProvider implements org.glassfish.hk2.api.Factory<Transaction> in order to facilitate @injecting Transactions into classes via HK2 (https://eclipse-ee4j.github.io/jersey.github.io/documentation/latest/ioc.html#d0e17033). It appears that an attempt was made to change this approach in https://github.com/fcrepo4/fcrepo4/pull/1559/files . Instead of Injecting TransactionProvider, I believe we should be Injecting Transaction... and allowing the TransactionProvider Factory to "provide" the Transaction.
I will look into...
